example.eg: The tour guide leads the people through the city.
example.egtrans: 导游带着人们在城里游玩。

example.eg: The priest leads the congregation in prayer.
example.egtrans: 牧师带领教众祈祷。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 给…带头, 带领...做某事

example.eg: The general leads his troops well, so they do what he orders.
example.egtrans: 这位将军把军队带得很好，手下人都愿意服从他的命令。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 领导, 指挥, 率领

example.eg: The chief inspector leads the investigation.
example.egtrans: 总监领导这次调查。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 率领, 领导, 负责

example.eg: This road leads to the forest.
example.egtrans: 这条路通往树林。

example.eg: The employee's habitual tardiness led to his dismissal.
example.egtrans: 这位员工迟到成习惯，因此被开除了。

example.eg: Lead them to agreement with logical arguments.
example.egtrans: 用具有逻辑性的论点说服他们赞成。

example.eg: Jennifer's interest in animals led her to becoming a vet.
example.egtrans: 詹妮弗对动物的兴趣促使自己成为一名兽医。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 引起某人做某事, 促使某人做某事

example.eg: The German cyclist is currently leading the race.
example.egtrans: 那位德国自行车选手目前处于比赛领先位置。

example.eg: My grandfather led a hard life.
example.egtrans: 我祖父的一生过得很艰难。

example.eg: The screen was made of lead to prevent X-rays from passing through.
example.egtrans: 屏幕由铅造成，以防止 X 光穿过。

example.eg: The lead broke on this pencil, so I have to sharpen it.
example.egtrans: 这枝铅笔的笔芯断了，所以我只好削尖它。

example.eg: The lead speaker brought the audience to its feet with his wit.  The lead story in the paper is about the bribery scandal.
example.egtrans: 该名主要发言人让听众对他的智慧佩服得五体投地。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 主要的, 首要的, 最重要的

example.eg: The lead runner was on second base.
example.egtrans: 领跑运动员在二垒。

dsense.name: lead
dsense.guideword: (American Football pass: made into space) (传球)

example.eg: The lead pass arrived at midfield just as the receiver got there.

dsense.name: lead
dsense.guideword: (weight made of lead) (如铅球、铅饼等)

example.eg: Pass me those two leads please.  I need to weigh this down.
The gangster filled his rival with lead.
The typesetter cut a lead to fit the line, and put it in the composing stick.
example.egtrans: 排字工将行间铅条剪短，使其符合行距，然后再将其放进排字盘内。

example.eg: Add another lead between those lines, so there will be more separation between them.
example.egtrans: 增加行间距，这样行与行就分得更开了。

example.eg: Ben hadn't trained for the race, so the lead wasn't a position he expected to find himself in.
example.egtrans: 本没有为赛跑做训练准备，所以不指望自己能跑领先位置。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 领先位置, 领先地位

example.eg: He had a lead of three minutes over the next runner.
example.egtrans: 他领先下一名赛跑者三分钟。

example.eg: The lead is a Nigerian runner.
The investigator caught the thief after finding the important lead.
example.egtrans: 调查员在发现了重要线索之后，抓到了小偷。

example.eg: Do you know who is going to play the lead in this movie?  The lead in the film was a famous actress.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 主要角色，主角, 主演

example.eg: The article's lead stated all the main facts.
example.egtrans: 这篇新闻的导语陈述了所有的主要事实。

example.eg: Follow my lead, and you will be a success.
example.egtrans: 以我为榜样，你会成功的。

example.eg: The whole team followed his lead.
example.egtrans: 整支队伍由他领导。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 领导, 领导权, 领导地位

example.eg: John took the lead and played first.
example.egtrans: 由约翰首先出牌。

example.eg: It is your lead.  Go ahead and play.
example.egtrans: 该你开牌。出牌吧。

example.eg: The lead was an ace of hearts.
example.egtrans: 首先打出的是红桃A。

example.eg: First, connect the red lead to the brown connector.
example.egtrans: 首先，将红色的电线与棕色的连接器相连。

example.eg: The hunter gave the target a lead of about a metre.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 超前的距离, 与...相距的距离

example.eg: Dogs must be kept on a lead at all times in this park.
Max uses social media to generate leads for his business.
Rita, who works in Sales, spends her day on the phone chasing up leads.
If your horse begins to tire, changing the lead to its right leg may help.

dsense.name: lead, lead line, US also: lead rope

example.eg: The rider attached the lead to the horse's halter.
example.egtrans: 骑手将缰绳系在马的笼头上。

example.eg: If you lead, I'll follow.
example.egtrans: 你带路，我跟着。

example.eg: The runner leads by thirty metres.
The boxer led with his left fist.
example.egtrans: 拳击手挥出左拳先向对手出击。

example.eg: Runners often lead with two outs.
I don't know this dance. You will have to lead.
The president is able to lead public opinion with his comments to the press.
He led an ace of hearts.
Lead the target by a foot or two.
Don't throw the ball where he is, you need to lead him by throwing ahead of him.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 扔到…前面, 扔得比…远

example.eg: He led the other runner by 30 meters.
The conductor has led this orchestra for two years.
You lead this hand.  Throw your card.
He gracefully lead his partner in the waltz.
example.egtrans: 他优雅地领着舞伴跳华尔兹。

example.eg: All of which leads me to my next point, which is that the project cannot possibly be completed on time.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 将...引开, 把…引到别的地方

example.eg: I've forgotten the way to the hotel: could someone lead me back, please?
Opening titles lead into a movie.
Let's lead off by introducing ourselves.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 与…相连，紧挨…, 与…毗连

example.eg: "Lead on!" she said, and I showed her along the corridor.
example.egtrans: “带路！”她说到，我便领着她沿走廊前行。

example.eg: I thought he loved me, but he was just leading me on.
example.egtrans: 我以为他爱我，可他其实一直在哄骗我。

example.eg: We hope that this early success will lead on to further triumphs.
The days leading up to the wedding were so busy, with many details to finalise.
In court, the police officer recounted the events leading up to the defendant's arrest.
The speaker led up to the topic by telling the audience about some of the historical background.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把...作为重要报道, 将...作为头条
以...开场, 一上场就打出

dsense.name: dog leash, also UK: dog lead

example.eg: As Jack was always running off with other dogs, we have to put him on a dog leash when we take him for a walk now.
The leader of the exercise class wanted us to follow her lead.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 效法某人, 以某人为榜样

example.eg: Up by thirteen points over the hated Bears, the Wolves are currently in the lead.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 处于领先地位, 率先

example.eg: This change was reflected in the opinion polls conducted in the lead up to the election.
Young people can so easily be led astray by false values.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…引向歧途, 把…带坏了

example.eg: The conman led investors in the scheme astray with promises of easy profit.

dsense.name: lead by example
dsense.guideword: (behave as you wish others to do)

example.eg: If you want your children to be compassionate, lead by example.

dsense.name: lead [sb] down the garden path, lead [sb] up the garden path

example.eg: I never suspected he was just leading me down the garden path.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 欺骗, 某人, 使某人上当

example.eg: Company newsletters are one method of lead generation.
Much of the countryside has been scarred by the lead mining that used to take place.
When I was a child I accidentally stabbed my leg with a lead pencil and you can still see the mark today!
Removing old lead-based paintwork without wearing a mask can cause lead poisoning.
My son got the lead role in the school play.

dsense.name: lead singer
dsense.guideword: (main singer in a popular music group)

example.eg: He's always wanted to be the lead singer in a rock band.
John knows where we are going, so he will lead the way.
Ford led the way into mass-produced automobiles.
You didn't give me enough lead time to finish this project.
example.egtrans: 你没有给我足够的研制时间来完成该项目。

dsense.name: lead [sb] to believe
dsense.guideword: often passive (mislead into thinking) (有误导之意)

example.eg: The financial advisor led me to believe that my investments were safe.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使某人相信，让某人相信

example.eg: Old houses often have dangerous lead-based paint on the walls.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 铅基涂料，含铅涂料，铅基油漆

example.eg: Every day this news program always starts with the anchor reading the same lead-in.
The politician made promises in the lead-up to the election that he failed to keep once he came to power.
example.egtrans: 这位政客在竞选的先导阶段作出了承诺，但他执政后却无法兑现。

example.eg: A pencil with retractable lead is great because you don't have to sharpen it.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 活动铅芯, 伸缩铅芯
潜在客户, 销售机会

dsense.name: strain at the leash (US), strain at the lead (UK)

example.eg: The dog was so determined to chase the cat, it was straining at the leash.
With a burst of speed, Jack took the lead in the race.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 首先行动, 带头进行

example.eg: This car only runs on unleaded gasoline.
Fill it with unleaded, please.
